paper_title.ja: 2次元t-Jモデルにおける超伝導状態の不可能性
paper_title.en: Absence of superconductivity in the t-J model at finite temperatures

description.ja: 銅酸化物高温超伝導体を記述するモデルとして導入された２次元t−J モデルは，平均場近似や数値解析等の枠組みでは，うまく超伝導の対形成や対の対称性が説明されたように見える．しかし，厳密な２次元系として捉えると，有限温度においてはd_<x^2-y^2>波対称の超伝導秩序は実現不可能であることがボゴリューボフの不等式により厳密に示される．Two dimensional t-J model which introduced to describe high-T_c oxides well explained the symmetry of the order parameter and the transition temperature of superconductivity within the mean-field theory. However, it is rigorously shown that this model does not exhibit d_<x^2-y^2> wave pairing at finite temeratures with use of Bogoliubove's inequality.

publication_name.ja: 愛知教育大学研究報告(自然科学編)

paper_title.en: ELECTRONIC STATES IN THE D-P MODEL WITH P-P DIRECT TRANSFER

description.en: Effects of the transfer integral between p-orbitals, t(pp). on the electronic states (in particular, the so-called in-gap states) in the d-p model are investigated within the approximation to the leading order in the 1/N expansion, by solving the self-consistent equations for the single particle Green's functions numerically in the low-temperature limit. They are critically dependent upon the sip of t(pp): negative t(pp) affects the overall electronic structures near the Fermi level, including the in-gap states and the main p-bands, only quantitatively, while positive t(pp) changes those even qualitatively. In the latter case, it always happens that the main p-bands overlap indirectly with the in-gap band by increasing the number of doped holes, and the system becomes semi-metallic.

paper_title.en: ELECTRONIC STATES IN THE D-P MODEL WITH P-P DIRECT TRANSFER

description.en: Effects of the transfer integral between p-orbitals, t(pp). on the electronic states (in particular, the so-called in-gap states) in the d-p model are investigated within the approximation to the leading order in the 1/N expansion, by solving the self-consistent equations for the single particle Green's functions numerically in the low-temperature limit. They are critically dependent upon the sip of t(pp): negative t(pp) affects the overall electronic structures near the Fermi level, including the in-gap states and the main p-bands, only quantitatively, while positive t(pp) changes those even qualitatively. In the latter case, it always happens that the main p-bands overlap indirectly with the in-gap band by increasing the number of doped holes, and the system becomes semi-metallic.

paper_title.en: ON THE 1/N-EXPANSION STUDIES OF INFINITE-U ANDERSON MODELS

description.en: The most important results obtained through a series of the present authors' studies on the bosonic versions of the infinite- U impurity- and lattice-Anderson models with use of the rigorous expansion with respect to inverse power of the spin-orbit degeneracy N (1/N-expansion) are reviewed and their physical implications are discussed in comparison with the results obtained in the other 1/N-expansion studies as well as their relating experimental observations.

paper_title.en: ON THE 1/N-EXPANSION STUDIES OF INFINITE-U ANDERSON MODELS

description.en: The most important results obtained through a series of the present authors' studies on the bosonic versions of the infinite- U impurity- and lattice-Anderson models with use of the rigorous expansion with respect to inverse power of the spin-orbit degeneracy N (1/N-expansion) are reviewed and their physical implications are discussed in comparison with the results obtained in the other 1/N-expansion studies as well as their relating experimental observations.

paper_title.ja: Metal-Insulator Transition and Charge Fluctuation in the d - p Model

paper_title.en: Metal-Insulator Transition and Charge Fluctuation in the d - p Model
Electronic States in High-Tc Copper-Oxide Superconductors, II

description.en: The electronic states in the CuO2-layer have been studied by using the p-d model with the help of the auxiliary boson method for treating the local electronic correlation properly. What have been found are: at sufficiently low temperature the electronic states form coherent bands, whose width and intensity are strongly depending upon number of doped carriers (more significantly for holes than electrons) and the p-d charge transfer energy. In particular, when the number of doped-holes nh is small, a new band form around the Fermi level inside the energy gap and its width and intensity are proportional to nh. Even then the Fermi surface is still determined by the total number of unpaired electrons which are mainly of the localized d-electrons. © 1990, THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: journal of the physical society of japan

paper_title.en: Electronic States in High-Tc Copper-Oxide Superconductors, II

description.en: The electronic states in the CuO2-layer have been studied by using the p-d model with the help of the auxiliary boson method for treating the local electronic correlation properly. What have been found are: at sufficiently low temperature the electronic states form coherent bands, whose width and intensity are strongly depending upon number of doped carriers (more significantly for holes than electrons) and the p-d charge transfer energy. In particular, when the number of doped-holes nh is small, a new band form around the Fermi level inside the energy gap and its width and intensity are proportional to nh. Even then the Fermi surface is still determined by the total number of unpaired electrons which are mainly of the localized d-electrons. © 1990, THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: journal of the physical society of japan

paper_title.en: Electronic States in High-Tc Copper-Oxide Superconductors

description.en: The electronic states in the CuO2-layer have been studied by using the p-d model with the help of the bosonic technique for treating the local electronic correlation properly. What have been found are: at sufficiently low temperature the electronic states form coherent bands but there is a significant difference between the effects of electron doping and those of hole doping. In particular, the hole doping brings about a new band around the Fermi level inside the energy gap and intensity of the band increases as the number of holes increases. These band schemes may well explain the experiments. © 1989, THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Journal of the Physical Society of Japan

In particular, the hole doping brings about a new band around the Fermi level inside the energy gap and intensity of the band increases as the number of holes increases. These band schemes may well explain the experiments. © 1989, THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN. All rights reserved.
